snippet: The fact the stock market is up this month, albeit only a little, should remind us that the cliché “investors hate uncertainty” is nonsense.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that uncertainty over the fiscal cliff is having incidentally beneficial effects on economy, as companies issue dividends and high-net individuals sell off assets and donate to charities in order to take advantage of current tax rules.
lead_paragraph: The fact the stock market is up this month, albeit only a little, should remind us that the cliché “investors hate uncertainty” is nonsense.

headline.print_headline: Revenue Up, Deficit Falls: Fiscal Cliff Gets Credit
headline.seo: Uncertainty in Washington, Windfall for Others
headline.main: Revenue Rises, Deficit Falls: Fiscal Cliff Gets Credit
